snippet: On average, since 1976, the challenging-party candidate gained one and a half percentage points on the incumbent-party candidate. But no candidate trailing by as much as Mitt Romney heading into the first debate went on to win.
abstract: On average, since 1976, the challenging-party candidate gained one and a half percentage points on the incumbent-party candidate. But no candidate trailing by as much as Mitt Romney heading into the first debate went on to win.

headline.main: First Debate Often Helps Challenger in Polls
